wikipedia_page.main: Walter Colquhoun Grant (27 May 1822 – 27 August 1861) was British Army officer and a pioneer settler in what is today British Columbia.  He served briefly as a colonial surveyor but left after a few years to rejoin the army.  He died while in the service in Saugor, Bengal, India at 39.

response: His son, Walter Colquhoun Grant, also became an army officer, the youngest captain in the army at 24, before financial troubles saw him become an early settler in the Colony of Vancouver Island.  He later rejoined the army, serving in the Crimean War and Indian Mutiny.
*Walter Colquhoun Grant (1822–1861), British Army officer and a pioneer settler in British Columbia.
* Walter Colquhoun Grant (1822–1861), British Army officer and settler in British Columbia.
